Amerio, S.; Amidei, D.; Anastassov, A.; Annovi, A.; Akimoto, T.; Albrow, M.G.; Ambrose, D.; Abulencia, A.; Affolder, T.; Anikeev, K.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="506" ind1=" " ind2="0"><subfield code="a">Free-to-read</subfield><subfield code="f">Unrestricted online access</subfield><subfield code="2">star</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="520" ind1="3" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">The authors measure the ratio of cross section times branching fraction, σ{sub χc2}β(χ{sub c2} → J/ψγ)/σ{sub χc1}β(χ{sub c1} → J/ψγ), in 1.1 fb⁻¹ of p{bar p} collisions at √s = 1.96 TeV. This measurement covers the kinematic range p{sub T} (J/ψ) > 4.0 GeV/c, </subfield><subfield code=" ">< 1.0, and p{sub T}(γ) > 1.0 GeV/c. For events due to prompt processes, they find R{sub p} = 0.395 ± 0.016(stat.) ± 0.015(sys.). This result represents a significant improvement in precision over previous measurements of prompt χ{sub c1,2} hadroproduction.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="536" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield all_text_timv: Measurement of sigma(chi(c2)B(chi(c2) ---> J / psi gamma) / sigma(chi(c1)B(chi(c1) ---> J / psi gamma) in p anti-p collisions at s**(1/2) = 1.96-TeV [electronic resource]. Washington, D.C. : United States. Dept. of Energy, 2007. Oak Ridge, Tenn. : Distributed by the Office of Scientific and Technical Information, U.S. Dept. of Energy. 7 pages : digital, PDF file. text txt rdacontent computer c rdamedia online resource cr rdacarrier Published through SciTech Connect. 03/01/2007. "fermilab-pub-07-066-e" "arXiv eprint number hep-ex/0703028" FT Adelman, J.; Amerio, S.; Amidei, D.; Anastassov, A.; Annovi, A.; Akimoto, T.; Albrow, M.G.; Ambrose, D.; Abulencia, A.; Affolder, T.; Anikeev, K. Free-to-read Unrestricted online access star The authors measure the ratio of cross section times branching fraction, σ{sub χc2}β(χ{sub c2} → J/ψγ)/σ{sub χc1}β(χ{sub c1} → J/ψγ), in 1.1 fb⁻¹ of p{bar p} collisions at √s = 1.96 TeV. This measurement covers the kinematic range p{sub T} (J/ψ) > 4.0 GeV/c,  < 1.0, and p{sub T}(γ) > 1.0 GeV/c. For events due to prompt processes, they find R{sub p} = 0.395 ± 0.016(stat.) ± 0.015(sys.). This result represents a significant improvement in precision over previous measurements of prompt χ{sub c1,2} hadroproduction.
